dt: {bc}a bar extending from one post or support to another and serving as a guard or barrier
{bc}a light structure serving as a guard at the outer edge of a ship's deck
{bc}a bar of rolled steel forming a track for wheeled vehicles

et: Middle English {it}raile{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}raille, reille{/it} bar, rule, from Latin {it}regula{/it} straightedge, rule {ma}{mat|rule|}{/ma}
shortdef: a bar extending from one post or support to another and serving as a guard or barrier
to provide with a railing : fence

dt: {bc}any of numerous wading birds (family Rallidae, the rail family) that are of small or medium size and have short rounded wings, a short tail, and usually very long toes which enable them to run on the soft mud of marshes

shortdef: any of numerous wading birds (family Rallidae, the rail family) that are of small or medium size and have short rounded wings, a short tail, and usually very long toes which enable them to run on the soft mud of marshes

dt: {bc}to revile or scold in harsh, insolent, or abusive language

pt: {sc}scold{/sc} {sc}upbraid{/sc} {sc}berate{/sc} {sc}rail{/sc} {sc}revile{/sc} {sc}vituperate{/sc} mean to reproach angrily and abusively. {sc}scold{/sc} implies rebuking in irritation or ill temper justly or unjustly.
{sc}upbraid{/sc} implies censuring on definite and usually justifiable grounds.
{sc}berate{/sc} suggests prolonged and often abusive scolding.
{sc}revile{/sc} implies a scurrilous, abusive attack prompted by anger or hatred.

pt.t: an alleged killer {it}reviled{/it} in the press

et: Middle English, from Middle French {it}railler{/it} to mock, probably from Old French {it}reillier{/it} to growl, mutter, from Vulgar Latin {it}*ragulare{/it} to bray, from Late Latin {it}ragere{/it} to neigh
shortdef: to revile or scold in harsh, insolent, or abusive language

dt: {bc}one that makes logs into fence rails

shortdef: one that makes logs into fence rails

dt: {bc}a railing in front of an altar separating the chancel from the body of the church

shortdef: a railing in front of an altar separating the chancel from the body of the church

dt: {bc}a molding on a wall around a room to protect the wall from being damaged by the backs of chairs

dt.t: … had removed the {wi}chair rail{/wi}, thereby eliminating the dado effect …

shortdef: a molding on a wall around a room to protect the wall from being damaged by the backs of chairs

dt: {bc}a grayish-brown long-billed American rail ({it}Rallus longirostris{/it}) that inhabits coastal marshes

shortdef: a grayish-brown long-billed American rail (Rallus longirostris) that inhabits coastal marshes

dt: {bc}a rail about the mast near the deck to which rigging is belayed

shortdef: a rail about the mast near the deck to which rigging is belayed

dt: {bc}a means of urban railway transportation using trolley cars

shortdef: a means of urban railway transportation using trolley cars
